definition: to buy on credit/to delay payment
to buy or sell on credit/distant/long (time)/to forgive

sentences.english: We never made a purchase on credit.
I buy that bike on credit.
On receipt of this email you may start making credit purchases with us.
sentences.chinese: 收到此邮件后，您就可以在我们公司进行赊购了。

sentences.english: What is needed is a market in child-abuse credits.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要的是一个儿童体罚赊购市场。

sentences.english: I bought that bike on credit.
We bought the dishwasher on credit.
sentences.chinese: 我们是用赊购方式买这太洗碟机的。

sentences.english: They is inexperienced in business and extreme caution is advise in grant credit.
sentences.chinese: 该公司缺乏经营经验，故在答应赊购时应特别谨慎。

sentences.english: In ten days she ran up a twelve-hundred-dollar bill.
sentences.chinese: 不出十天，她就赊购了一千两百元的货款。

sentences.english: We have accounts with most of our suppliers.
sentences.chinese: 我们与大多数供应商都是实行赊购制。

definition: to offer credit/credit transaction/to buy or sell on account
to buy or sell on credit/outstanding account/to have an outstanding account
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to defer payment/to pay back over long term
to write an IOU or promissory note
to sell as agent/to sell on commission (e.g. insurance policies)/proxy sale (of stocks)
to get an advance on one's pay
